titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. John W. Flora and George Herenden, Indictment
CWG0978

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
Campbell Circuit Court
The Com"mth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Indictment for refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
John W Flora & Geo Herendon Defendants

The Grand jury of Campbell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse John W Flora and George Herendon of the offense of refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter, Committed as follows, viz; The said John W Flora and Geo Herendon on the day of August, 1865, and on divers other days and times, before the and Since that time, and before the finding of this Indictment, in Said County and State aforesaid, Being officers of an Election then and there held at the Carthage Precinct in Said
County under the Constitution and laws of the State aforesaid, for the Election of a member of the Congress of the United States, for the 6th Congressional District of Ky, a State Treasurer, a Senator from the 25th Senatorial District of Said State, Two Members of the General Assembly, for the County aforesaid, and a Clerk of the Circuit Court for the County aforesaid, The Said Flora being then & there a Judge of Said Election, and the Said Herendon being then & there the Sheriff of the Said Election, and Severally acting as Such, at the time and place aforesaid having been duly appointed and qualified as Aaid Judge and Sheriff, The Jury aforesaid in the name and by the authority aforesaid, do further say that at the Election aforesaid for the purpose aforesaid, on the day and year aforesaid John W Flora Nelson a qualified voter of Said Precinct and County,
did then & there appear at the Polls before the Judges, Sheriff and Clerk of the said Election, between the hours of Seven Oclock A. M, and Six Oclock P, M, and then & there did offer to vote, Whereupon the Said John W Flora and George Herendon as Judge & Sheriff of Said Election Respectively did Knowingly unlawfully and Corruptly refuse to receive the vote of the Said John Nelson Contrary to the Statutes in Such Cases made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

Witnesses
John Nelson
John J Nelson

A Copy
Attest Benj Beall clk
Campbell Circuit Court

151
The Commonwealth
Against
John W Flora & Geo Herendon
Indictment for Refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
A True Bill
G. W. Carmack
Foreman
Filed 25th Aug 1865
B W issd Aug 28th "
